text: The PR1 men's single sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. A top-seven finish ensured qualification for the Tokyo Paralympics. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 25 August 2019 || 15:15 || Heats |- | Wednesday 28 August 2019 || 10:15 || Repechages |- | Thursday 29 August 2019 || 09:45 || Semifinals C/D |- | Friday 30 August 2019 || 11:00 || Semifinals A/B |- | Saturday 31 August 2019 || 09:10 || Final D |- | rowspan=3|Sunday 1 September 2019 || 10:43 || Final C |- | 11:30 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 13:21 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== Heat winners advanced directly to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Erik Horrie | each repechage advanced to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the D final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Johannes Schmidt | align="left"| | 10:41.51 | FC |- | 2 | align="left"|Alejandro Vera | align="left"| | 10:49.28 | FC |- | 3 | align="left"|Loren Pearson | align="left"| | 11:01.52 | FC |- | 4 | align="left"|Michel Muñoz | align="left"| | 11:10.78 | FD |- | 5 | align="left"|Angel Font | align="left"| | 11:26.37 | FD |- | 6 | align="left"|Ilian Mladenov | align="left"| | 11:35.86 | FD |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Zsolt Peto | align="left"| | 10:35.57 | FC |- | 2 | align="left"|Ha Jae-heon | align="left"| | 10:39.48 | FC |- | 3 | align="left"|Louis Toussaint | align="left"| | 10:42.56 | FC |- | 4 | align="left"|Takayuki Endo | align="left"| | 10:42.88 | FD |- | 5 | align="left"|Jose Duarte | align="left"| | 12:06.80 | FD |} ===Semifinals A/B=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Roman Polianskyi | align="left"| | 9:26.94 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Erik Horrie | align="left"| | 9:32.27 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Alexey Chuvashev | align="left"| | 9:37.21 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Yang Jie | align="left"| | 9:58.50 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Blake Haxton | align="left"| | 10:02.82 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Julien Hardi | align="left"| | 10:29.61 | FB |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Benjamin Prichard | align="left"| | 9:46.13 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Rene Pereira | align="left"| | 9:55.19 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Shmuel Daniel | align="left"| | 10:07.43 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Jaroslaw Kailing | align="left"| | 10:17.79 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Augustas Navickas | align="left"| | 10:23.05 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Fabrizio Caselli | align="left"| | 10:30.83 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the other finals. ====Final D==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Michel Muñoz | align="left"| | 10:56.17 |- | 2 | align="left"|Takayuki Endo | align="left"| | 11:00.69 |- | 3 | align="left"|Angel Font | align="left"| | 11:01.40 |- | 4 | align="left"|Ilian Mladenov | align="left"| | 11:32.71 |- | 5 | align="left"|Jose Duarte | align="left"| | 12:11.80 |} ====Final C==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Johannes Schmidt | align="left"| | 10:34.70 |- | 2 | align="left"|Louis Toussaint | align="left"| | 10:42.72 |- | 3 | align="left"|Alejandro Vera | align="left"| | 10:48.52 |- | 4 | align="left"|Ha Jae-heon | align="left"| | 10:53.69 |- | 5 | align="left"|Zsolt Peto | align="left"| | 10:59.15 |- | 6 | align="left"|Loren Pearson | align="left"| | 11:03.15 |} ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Blake Haxton | align="left"| | 10:06.33 |- | 2 | align="left"|Jaroslaw Kailing | align="left"| | 10:24.62 |- | 3 | align="left"|Yang Jie | align="left"| | 10:29.45 |- | 4 | align="left"|Fabrizio Caselli | align="left"| | 10:30.10 |- | 5 | align="left"|Augustas Navickas | align="left"| | 10:32.21 |- | 6 | align="left"|Julien Hardi | align="left"| | 10:45.51 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |- | | align="left"|Roman Polianskyi | align="left"| | 9:12.99 | '''''' |- | | align="left"|Alexey Chuvashev | align="left"| | 9:19.43 | |- | | align="left"|Erik Horrie | align="left"| | 9:23.86 | |- | 4 | align="left"|Benjamin Prichard | align="left"| | 9:24.80 | |- | 5 | align="left"|Rene Pereira | align="left"| | 9:42.61 | |- | 6 | align="left"|Shmuel Daniel | align="left"| | 10:00.98 | |} ==References== Category:2019 World Rowing Championships
